docblock.description: This method is used to used to specify a set of fields to return, thereby restricting the amount of data returned in the response.

docblock.description: Collapses the result set to a single document per group before it forwards the result set to the rest of the search components.

docblock.description: Instructs Solr what kinds of Request parameters should be included in the response for debugging purposes, legal values include:

description.compact: Enables/Disables the Expand Component

Specifies the number of results to return for each group. The server default value is 1.
If true, the result of the first field grouping command is used as the main result list in the response, using group.format=simple.
If true, Solr includes the number of groups that have matched the query in the results.
Sets the group.offset parameter.
If true, facet counts are based on the most relevant document of each group matching the query.
Enables or disables highlighting
